description:
Crowds gather on New Year’s Eve to watch the annual ball drop, fireworks and countdown in New York’s Times Square to usher in 2024.

Footage credit: Associated Press and Times Square Alliance/Countdown Entertainment
title: New Year’s countdown 2024: Watch the New York ball drop
author: Associated Press

description:
Dubai celebrated the New Year with another spectacular fireworks display from the iconic Burj Khalifa. 

The elaborate fireworks display at the world's tallest skyscraper rang in 2024 with a bang, and filled the vicinity with awe and wonder at the extricate details.

title: New Year's 2024: Dubai puts on dazzling fireworks show from iconic Burj Khalifa
author: Global News

description:
Japan has issued a major tsunami warning after a 7.6 magnitude earthquake struck the central region.
 
Residents in the coastal Noto area in Ishikawa prefecture were asked to "evacuate immediately to higher ground," national broadcaster NHK said.
 
Authorities have warned of waves as high as 5m in Noto.
 
They also issued tsunami warnings for neighbouring Niigata and Toyama prefectures, where they said waves could reach 3m.
 
Public television flashed "EVACUATE" in big letters, urging residents to flee to higher ground despite the winter weather.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Japan #Earthquake #BBCNews
title: Tsunami warning in Japan after strong earthquake | BBC News
author: BBC News

description:
Watch as the clock strikes midnight in Sydney and Australians ring in the 2024 New Year. 

Last year, more than 7,000 fireworks were launched from the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and another 2,000 from the nearby Opera House.

Footage credit: AuBC/CITY OF SYDNEY
title: Sydney fireworks 2024: Watch Australia ring in the New Year
author: Associated Press

description:
Copyright protections on many well-known books, films and musical compositions are set to expire in 2024. Disney's Mickey Mouse is getting a lot of attention as one famous iteration of the classic mouse is set to enter the public domain. CBS News' Jo Ling Kent has the story.

"CBS Saturday Morning" co-hosts Jeff Glor, Michelle Miller and Dana Jacobson deliver two hours of original reporting and breaking news, as well as profiles of leading figures in culture and the arts. Watch "CBS Saturday Morning" at 7 a.m. ET on CBS and 8 a.m. ET on the CBS News app.

description:
Thieves are stealing Apple iPhones, passcodes and thousands of dollars from their victims’ bank accounts. 

WSJ’s Joanna Stern sat down with a convicted thief in a high-security prison to find how—and how you can protect yourself.

Chapters:
0:00 Vulnerability in Apple’s software
1:28 Getting the phone and passcode
3:33 Getting into Apple account
4:33 Getting into the money
5:55 Selling the phones
7:21 Protecting yourself
8:40 The future of iPhone theft

Tech Things With Joanna Stern
Everything is now a tech thing. In creative and humorous videos, WSJ senior personal tech columnist Joanna Stern explains and reviews the products, services and trends that are changing our world.

#Apple #iPhone #WSJ
title: iPhone Thief Explains How He Breaks Into Your Phone | WSJ
author: The Wall Street Journal
